intro: Lipochaeta lobata var. incisor, commonly known as the narrowleaf lipochaeta, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its leaves are narrow and often have a serrated edge, giving it its common name. It produces small, yellow flowers that attract various pollinators like bees and butterflies.
